definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: It consists of multiple passages and empty rooms.
sentences.chinese: 这层楼面上有多条过道和多个空房间。

sentences.english: There was a mansion on the island, which was connected to an old castle by a passageway.
sentences.chinese: 岛上有座府邸，通过一条过道连向另一座旧城堡。

sentences.english: Using a small piece of metal he grabbed in the catwalks, he shorts out the fans.
sentences.chinese: 用一块过道内的小金属块，他将风扇组的电路短接了。

sentences.english: I would like a seat on the aisle .
The aisle was floored with ancient bricks.
sentences.chinese: 过道由古旧的砖块铺就。

sentences.english: she started hearing the word "faggot" in the hallways at school.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在校园过道中听到“同性恋”这类词汇。

sentences.english: I think my seat is near the aisle.
sentences.chinese: 我想我的座位是靠近过道的。

sentences.english: Get to a hard-to-reach spot in a wintery place outside Crystal Path.
sentences.chinese: 在如冬的地方外的水晶过道上，找到一个隐藏地点。

sentences.english: The halls and stairways are commodious.
sentences.chinese: 大厅和楼梯过道都很宽敞。

sentences.english: The whispers of many men and the protestations of the portress were audible in the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 过道里有许多人说话的声音和那看门妇人的争辩声。

sentences.english: Ms. Booker: OK. I have several seats available. Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat?
sentences.chinese: 好的，我有几张票。你要靠窗户的还是过道的？

sentences.english: Tiptoeing down the hallway, she eyed the front door warily.
sentences.chinese: 她踮着脚尖沿着过道走过去。

sentences.english: After the blizzard he shoveled the front walk.
sentences.chinese: 大风雪过后，他用铲子清除了前面过道上的积雪。

sentences.english: Make sure aisle ways can accommodate forklifts.
sentences.chinese: 保证过道可容纳或通行搬运工具。

sentences.english: There was no one in the corridor. He hastened to the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 过道里已没有人，他冲到楼梯口。

sentences.english: The corridor took a turn and became dark.
sentences.chinese: 过道转了个弯便阴暗了。

definition: head of a flight of stairs
drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
